main_definition: To render someone or something unable to function properly, typically due to injury, damage, or other reasons.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To prevent from working properly; to make incapable of functioning normally
meanings_and_examples.example: The accident left him temporarily disabled and unable to walk.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To take away the rights or privileges of someone, usually legally or through a decision
meanings_and_examples.example: After being found guilty of fraud, he was disqualified from holding any public office.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In gaming, to temporarily hinder an opponent's ability to participate effectively in the game
meanings_and_examples.example: The power-up disabled her enemy for a few seconds, giving her an advantage.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make someone dependent on others due to loss of function or disability
meanings_and_examples.example: He became disabled and had to rely on his family for daily care after the accident.
